ratings.comment: Explained concepts well but often expected students to know answers to everything before learning, which got annoying sometimes. Seems like a nice professor but never interacted with him personally.

Chemistry 103 has been by far one of the most difficult classes I have ever taken. Both Professor Nathanson and Brunold are very supportive and interactive professors. They explain concepts very throughly and are easy to access for help after class. I would not have passed this class without them.

He's very passionate about chemistry and you could tell through his lectures. He makes a lot of jokes and includes experiments while he presents. Sometimes, he messes up with technology during lectures but other than that, he knows what he's talking about. He walks around the lecture hall and checks in with students
Cares a lot about his students; willing to fight to give his students what they need to succeed.

This guy loves chem so much, he actually (almost) made me start to like it too. I've never heard anyone talk with so much genuine excitement and passion about atoms. He talks and looks like the crazy evil scientists you'd see in movies, in the best way possible. This class is tough, but thankfully I had him as my prof.

Nathanson is a super fun lecturer and is very passionate about the material. When I took the class he did a joint-lecture with another professor. He is very helpful and cares about if students understand the topic. However, come prepared to work hard in order to succeed in this class, as they will not hold your hand forever.

He was amazing guys. Very kind and cares for his students! During lecture we did tophat and he would walk around and explain things to people if they didn't understand the concepts. Wish I had him for chem 104 :( But if you guys are able to have him definitely take any class with him!

Professor Nathanson is one of the best professors I have had at UW-Madison. This semester he was out for a bit after he injured his arm and got surgery, but that didn't stop him from coming back and teaching us in a way that helped me understand. His humor and engagement made lectures interesting and made me actually want to learn.
The professor made chemistry fun!

The style of this course was amazing for helping me learn, and I think Dr. Nathanson was the perfect dude to teach it. Engaging, interacted with the room, and let us have a notecard for each exam, with a really easy curve. I never thought I'd get to say that Chem 103 was an easy A, but for me it was.

Last semester I really struggled with chemistry and ending up having to drop . So, when I came in at the beginning of this semester I had a bad attitude about the class. However, Dr. Nathanson had very engaging lectures and made learning about chemistry enjoyable and less intimidating. He clearly loves chemistry and his students!
He goes way too fast explaining concepts and never gives you enough time to do practice problems. He is always in a rush.

While Gil moves rather quickly in his lectures, he isn't nearly as overwhelming compared to his teaching counterparts. He maintains a sense of wonder about chemistry and has a playful attitude that makes both students and TAs giggle. His technological skills (i.e. TopHat navigation) are a bit clunky, but he has a sense of humor about it.

Professor Nathanson is a very good guy who cares about his student and is always available for help. Often times I found him to be a below-average lecturer and often was unclear with some of the difficult material. Overall I thought this was a tough class that was helped by the professor.
Prof. Nathanson is a great professor. Truly cares about students and wants to see them do well. The class is difficult but he makes it better.

Gil is an amazing lecturer. Although he might go fast, if you do all of the pre-class material, what he says should clarify all of the pre-class material. The TopHats help out a lot. He really cares about the students and makes every lecture enjoyable! My biggest tip for success in this course is to show up to class and do all of the study material
Extremely passionate about chemistry and always available and eager to help students who need it!
Awesome professor. Very knowledgeable on topics and covers them well. Take his classes whenever possible.

Nathanson is dope. Really good at making all of the math in thermo actually mean something and is very engaging as a lecturer. Tests questions can come out of left field (he said "I hope you learn a lot" right before the final) but he grades fairly. Homework is definitely work, but discussion helps a lot. Would reccomend for any chem course.

Prof. Nathanson is a genuinely good guy who cares about his students, but isn't the greatest professor. His homework is outrageously time consuming and is pretty difficult, so it's more frustrating than it is helpful for learning the material. Tests are usually fine but sometimes a question comes out of left field. Good guy, not the best prof.
Interesting lectures and 90% of this course I learned previously in high school. Took as a prereq

Awesome Prof. Makes an impact on you even though you don't personally know him. Super funny and nerdy which is enjoyable because he knows what he's talking about and is able to explain it in the easiest way for freshmen and soph

Professor Nathanson is an incredibly energetic and enthusiastic lecturer. I really could tell how much he likes teaching and how much he cares about his students. However, I found many of his lectures hard to follow because he went so fast (due to his excitement) and thought that he was a bit disorganized.  Overall, though, good professor.

Professor Nathanson is a really goofy guy. He made lecture pretty enjoyable for a chemistry class. Demos were really cool especially if you sit in the front row. Encourages you to visit his office hours. Tests are tough but if you study hard you'll be okay. Not really necessary to read from the textbook as long as you understand what's going on.
amazing professor, really cares about his students and what he is teaching!! heard chem 103 was bad before taking it, but nathanson definitely makes it bearable

Professor Nathanson is a fantastic instructor and makes the material easy to understand as well as enjoyable. Easily my favorite professor this semester! He is enthusiastic about chemistry and wants you to be too!!
Very enthusiastic making lectures easier to pay attention in. The tests are not bad if you go to the problem solving sessions and do the practice worksheets/ exams. Also reading the book does help.

Very motivated teacher.  His interest and devotion to the topic made the class much more interesting.  He went a little fast on math based lectures for my liking but definitely one of the best lecturers Ive had.

Professor Nathanson is the only professor I've had at UW who GENUINELY cares about how well you understand the material. If he feels like the class is confused or not grasping a topic, he will make sure to go into it further to help your understanding. Going to problem-solving sessions and reading the book BEFORE class is extremely useful

He's the kind of guy you really want to get to know and get advice from your college career. He's really there to see you be successful. He makes his lectures super engaging, and his exams are carbon copies of lectures. He posts notes online. You can easily get an A if you just go to lecture, go to discussion, and participate in Lab.

Professor Nathanson is so passionate and transfers his love for chemistry even to students who are indifferent to the sciences. He teaches clearly, is funny, and genuinely made me want to go to lecture. Chem 103 is a difficult class, so make it a little easier on yourself by taking it with him!

If you have to take this class, take it with him. He is SO passionate about Chem which makes it so much more enjoyable (for a chem class). Tests are fair and there are TONS of opportunities for extra help. He tells us all the time, he wants everyone to love chemistry as much as he does. Also, practice exams are very similar to actual exams.
For a boring intro chem class, Nathanson made it enjoyable! He was very enthusiastic and explained concepts very well. He had a few good jokes too!

Awesome professor! Attendence was not mandatory but was encouraged via the in class "clicker" questions that were asked during each class.  You had to answer 80% of the questions throughout the semester.
Amazing professor. Lots of enthusiasm for chemistry which made the lectures interesting and the tests were fair. Highly recommend!!

Nathanson is FANTASTIC. I am a very picky student but there is very little that I would complain about with his lectures. As long as you come to class with an interest, stay awake, take notes and go to discussion, this class will honestly be fun to take.

TAKE CHEMISTRY WITH NATHANSON! Great professor! Always enthusiastic and very clear. His lectures are slower than Brunolds who is also a great lecturer, and is slower paced for better understanding. If you want to get an A, rewrite notes every day and do practice problems!! Best professor. challenging tests, generous curve
great professor that loves chemistry and comes to lecture very excited to teach it. Gives lectures unique names and is genuinely interested in the well being of his students
Makes chemistry fun and interactive. hes brilliant, went to harvard and yale i believe. Loves what he does, very easy to talk to. if you get the chance, take his class

Nathanson was a great teacher, though he tends to explain things in more complicated terms than they need to be. The online homework was a little ridiculous at times, but the exams were pretty fair. This dude also loves chem. Like, he really LOVES chem, and its nice to see a professor so passionate about the subject he teaches

Prof. Nathanson was a great teacher but also made early morning lectures entertaining! he speaks loud and clear and always answers questions and makes the class fun with lab demos and quirky jokes! Definitely go to office hours and he emails back pretty quickly also!
Very easy to understand and was very enthusiastic about the material. Made the class enjoyable.

Very enthusiastic. It's easier to understand his lectures if you go to class. Class curve was generous (24% got an A). Exams were moderate, usually needed to apply things learned. Stresses importance of group work! Earned an A in the class.
Tests are hard, quizzes are easy and very different from exams, do all assigned practice problems from the book.

This was a team-taught class and he was my favorite of the 2.  He is pretty clear on the material in lecture but you still have to read and do the suggested problems in order to do well! He is also extremely helpful, he wants you to do well so go to his office hours!

He is one of the VERY BEST instructors I have ever had - clear, enthusiastic, and funny. He is also very helpful and friendly - he has 3 hours of office hours per week! However, material is extremely difficult, so is his tests and problem sets - you MUST stay on top of the material to do well in this class. CRAMMING DOES NOT WORK IN THIS CLASS!!!
GREAT professor. Creative, energetic, seems to love chem and teaching it. Test question are usually simple mathematically but conceptual. You'll really ENJOY the class. And yes, this is Chemistry.
Pretty good professor.  Tests are very hard and some TA's are not that helpful.  I suggest going to the help session available, that are not run by the professor.  Extremely time comsumming.

Very few professors are capable of making their students laugh during a general chemistry lecture, but Nathanson knows how almost every lecture. He is very approachable and willing to help outside of class as well. He isn't easy, but he definitely makes the material worth learning.

Explains the tough concepts with perfect clarity. Lecture never feels overwhelming but a week later you realize he went over an entire field of chem in a couple days. GREAT PROFESSOR, STRAIGHTFORWARD EXAMS. Labs are a bit boring but all chem 103 labs are the same.
Professor Nathanson is a good lecturer. He is clearly passionate about the material. The exams aren't too bad and the curve is generous.
Great Lecturer! Always entertaining! And I actually understood most of what we covered because he knows exactly how to explain it!
one of my fav profs of all time
He is the best chem professor I've ever had. Very clear. He presents the material like a pro.  If you go to class and take the practice exams, you'll do well.  Not an 'easy' A but do-able.
Very clear and engaging. Approachable. Assigns a reasonable load and the exams are fine if you know the HW and practice exams.
Great professor! So clear, enthusiastic, and funny!
